alert.note: Alert for Riverside (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 05 at 5:29PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern California, including the following counties, Riverside and San Bernardino. * WHEN...Until 730 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in normally dry washes. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 529 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pinto Mountain Wilderness of Joshua Tree National Park, Pinto Wash. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to normally dry washes which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid washes and low lying areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
